children.subject: From what I gather, going under the unit cap and getting part time status are two different things. As a senior in L&S, it should be easy to go under the cap. However, if you don't get part time status (which they don't give you unless you petition for it and is not easy) you'd have to pay full tuition.

This semester, I'm interning part-time, so I followed the info on the L&S Advising website and submitted the form for reduced units: https://lsadvising.berkeley.edu/policies/unit-minimum-maximum. My request was approved within a day. However, I still have to pay full tuition. 

This page has the details on reduced tuition (under the Reduced Tuition for Part-Time Study heading): https://registrar.berkeley.edu/tuition-fees-residency/tuition-fees

reduced tuition is pretty hard to get approval for without extenuating circumstances, but an alternative is to sign up through UC Berkeley Extension as a concurrent enrollment student and pay based on the number of units. This does mean you don't get enrollment priority (at all), so make of that what you will.

history.content:
Hi, since Berkeley is now mostly remote for Spring 2021, I'm considering doing a full time internship next semester and continuing as a part time student taking just 1 course (out of interest, not a req). I've finished all my graduation requirements for L&S CS, and was planning on graduating after next semester anyway. 

I've heard that if we're a graduating senior, we are allowed to take under the unit cap (and be a part time student?). Do we get charged the same tuition as a part time student? Can I stick with my current enrollment time (and not be pushed to concurrent enrollment)? Also, do we need to get any approval for this?
history.subject: Part Time Student and Spring Internship (Graduating Senior)
